title: How does a person use science skills for STEM? - Quora

response.answer_text: Science is literally the first word in the acronym STEM. Realistically, science is the pursuit of and the understanding of nature. Without that there would be no engineering, or technology or math. the fields are intertwined. Tech and engineering require math and science. And math, while a separate subject in gradeschool is applied in sciences. Physics is the science of describing the universe in numbers and equations. When it comes to a real world application of the stem fields, science is pretty friggen important.

Don’t really understand the specific question, but Scientific skills encompasses a wide range of qualities from the practical Research skills, Critical Thinking, to Presentation Skills - all of which are crucial for success in Science. And with the STEM field (S- Science), a lot of these basic skills are conserved and required for success.
